bibl.title: Fletcher Decker v. State of Washington. Order Fixing Amount Of Bond.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION ........
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF FLETCHER DECKER FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND A WRIT OF CERTIORARI, : : : :
No. 6215. ORDER FIXING AMOUNT OF BOND

THIS MATTER coming on for hearing in open court on the oral motion of Beeler & Sullivan, attorneys for petitioner, and it appearing to the court that on or about the 14th day of September, 1921, an order was entered herein dismissing the writ of habeas corpus, and the petitioner being desirous of prosecuting appeal from the above entitled court to the Circuit Court of Appeals; petitioner being represented by his counsel Beeler & Sullivan, and the Government being represented by F.C. Reagan, Assistant United States Attorney; and the court having heard the argument of counsel and being fully advised in the premises; it is now by the court
ADJUDGED and ORDERED that the extradition bond of said petitioner be fixed in the sum of $600.00 if case, and the sum of $750.00 if property bond.
DONE in open court this 3rd day of October, 1921.
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON Northern DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF FLETCHER DECKER FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND A WRIT OF CERTIORARI,
FIlED IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT Western District of Washington NORTHERN DIVISION TH OCT 8 2021 F. M. Harshberger, Clerk By S.E. Lietch, Deputy
